column4: is this not relevant "Do NOT use the URL of the [get] link, since this is subject to change and can break easily."
that is a quote from the page you link are you clicking the get to download?
sorry I sent the link to you in error
ok good, thought i was going crazy, i provided no link

8.04 hit end of life on the 12th of this month. There were some significant changes from 8.04 to 10.04 grub-legacy to grub2 and ext3 to ext4 among a few, you might consider a backup and a fresh install.
thats what i want to do, my 10 live cd wont load(burnt 3) but 8 boots right up, just want to make sure the upgrade is to 10.04 or 10.10, not 11
so the original disc was burned as an image at the slowest speed and you checked the md5sum, these are all variables with that 10.04 iso and cd burned.
here is a link for checking the disc.  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToMD5SUM
yes the cd was burned slow and md5 sum checks out
the only time  have seen a propmt for a password s with a bad burn, if you have a xtrta usb thumb you might try that with a loader called unetbootin.
have tried a sandisk and kingston
i have a working version 8.04 cd, im going to install that to the hd and do what BorgTK2001 said about the update manager only showing LTS versions
didnt know update manager had that option till i came here
the IIRC is a helpful place.
